lines.text: Don't tell him what happened.
I don't know what happened!
Neither do I.
What *is* a cocktail dress?
Something to spill cocktails on.
Say, what is this... a frame-up?
Oh, well, you know, "Great minds..."
No, I don't know any great minds.
[Brad and Paula in the morgue]
My goodness, that looks just like a refrigerator. What is it?
A refrigerator.

[to Nick Martel]
In exactly twenty-eight minutes I have to start opening a gentleman's stomach. Maybe I can do as much for you some day.
Murphy, you're manna from heaven.
You mean that manna's here again?
I didn't know you went in for opening safes, Doc.
Oh, we surgeons open anything.

[to Paula]
I like things the way they are now. I can pick up my paper in the morning, read about a murder, and enjoy it.
Good morning, Doc.
Oh, good morning, Inspector.
You're looking pretty healthy for a corpse.

[as Stokes opens the apartment door]
Hello, Stokes.

[Dourly]
Mr. Bradford is not in.

[Paula can see him]
Oh, so I see.

[Cabbie is told to pull over]
Hey, what's the idea? You can't hire a hack to go half a block!

[Deftly]
My man, you are mistaken. I've done it.
[He gives the cabbie a large bill]
Forget the change.
[the cabbie is evidently satisfied and drives off]
